alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kanawha and southwestern Roane Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northeast of Sissonville, or 16 miles northeast of Charleston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clendenin, Amma, Left Hand, Looneyville and Walton. This includes Interstate 79 between mile markers 10 and 28. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. If outdoors, seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause ponding of water in urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage areas and low lying spots. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
